seasonal: November is historically one of the strongest months of the year for the S&P 500. In the last 30 years, the index closed on Nov 30 at a price HIGHER than it was on Nov 12 in approximately 87% of cases (26 out of 30 years). Seasonally bullish month with strong upward bias.

statistics.description: Multi-decade seasonal statistic: approximately 82% probability of upward movement on this date over the last 30 years
Multi-decade seasonal statistic: approximately 68% probability of upward movement on this date over the last 30 years
In the last 30 years, the index closed on Nov 30 at a higher price than Nov 12 in 87% of cases (26 out of 30). Strong bullish bias from mid-month to end of month.

insights: November 2025 is a moment of historical cycle convergence: 100-year (1925), 90-year (1935), 75-year (1950), 50-year (1975), and 45-year (1980) cycles all converge at this time point, signaling potential major shift
The weekly chart shows a clear uptrend with all three timeframe trends (primary, secondary, minor) aligned upward - long-only trades near support/retest zones are preferred
CNN Fear & Greed Index at 35 (Fear zone) at end of October - contrarian indicator suggests buying opportunity when fear is high

The market has been rising almost non-stop since April with nearly continuous gains of tens of percent - cyclical analysis warns this cannot continue forever, correction is not a question of if but when
RSI momentum is weakening though still positive; MACD has disappeared as a signal, suggesting the last breakout to new highs is not necessarily a breakout with momentum
The first Fibonacci retracement level of the rally from April (38.2%) coincides with the 6,120 area, also near the retest zone - a significant demand zone if reached
A 'continuing date/cycle' means if the turning date arrives while price is trending, the trend is expected to continue to the next turning date
A 'double cycle' occurs when two turning dates are close together - typically the first creates a counter-trend correction and the second resumes the original trend

When the market aspirates peak air, it is time to stay grounded - every decline becomes a buying opportunity and every headline about new records reinforces the bull, but experienced traders know this cannot last indefinitely
Time signals warning before price confirms - do not rush to exit or enter the market at extremes, let price confirm the time factor
The weekly picture is bullish but time is running out - two active monthly cycles and a cycle from October could create a meaningful shift mid-month
When acting against the overall trend, exercise double caution - entries should only be after clear reversal confirmation

technical.indicators: Weekly trend remains bullish with 6 consecutive monthly gains in the S&P and 7 in the Nasdaq - exceptional momentum. However, RSI negative divergence is developing. MACD signal weakening. Fear & Greed at 35 (Fear) end of October, dropping from 64 (end of August) and 52 (end of September). The 20 and 50-day moving averages have clear upward slope confirming trend continuation. The daily chart shows price compressed between resistance and rising trendline support around 6,500-6,567 area. An AB=CD pattern on the weekly chart targets 7,434 if breakout continues.

summary: November 2025 is a historically strong month for the S&P 500 with an 87% probability of higher close by month end compared to mid-month. However, multiple long-term historical cycles (45, 50, 75, 90, and 100-year cycles) all converge in November 2025, creating a rare moment that historically marks major turning points - not necessarily immediate crashes but seeds of significant shifts. The primary trend remains bullish but internal pressure is building as the market has risen almost continuously since April, and a technical correction is considered not a question of if but when.
previous_month_review: October 2025 had four turning dates for S&P 500. First date (Oct 2) did not work - failed to block the upward price movement. Second date (Oct 9) successfully blocked the uptrend and led to a sharp decline, marking a low in the next turning date range though not the lowest point. Third date (Oct 17) marked the low of the downward movement and triggered a significant rally wave to the next date at Oct 30. Fourth date (Oct 30-31) was a double cycle - initial decline was seen right at the high, but the cycle is still active so final results are pending. Overall 2 out of 4 dates captured the majority of monthly price movement.
risk_notes: Multiple century-scale cycles converging in 2025-2029 period: 100-year economic, 90-year political, and Shemitah (sabbatical year) cycles all pointing to 2029 as a major convergence point
Market has risen almost non-stop since April - exhaustion risk is elevated even if primary trend remains bullish

When leveraging stocks/ETFs (especially 2x or 3x leveraged), a correction of approximately 11% from current price could result in approximately 33% loss on 3x leveraged positions - manage position sizing carefully
Do not confuse a strong trend with an invincible one - when cycles of 45, 50, 75, 90 and 100 years converge, the world enters a zone of vibration where major change becomes probable
Fear & Greed index dropping from 64 to 35 in two months signals growing anxiety even as prices make new highs - divergence worth monitoring
RSI approaching overbought territory again warns of potential overextension

The approach is not to predict direction in advance but to identify potential turning points and observe price behavior at those dates to determine if a high, low, consolidation or acceleration is forming
